title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy. The special election must be held within 90 days of the Senate President's certification, following state laws. An exception exists for vacancies near a regularly scheduled election. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" requires a special election to fill a Senate vacancy within 90 days of the Senate President's certification. Exceptions apply for vacancies near regularly scheduled elections. States can still authorize temporary appointments until a special election is held. SEC. 297 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 amends Subtitle D of title II to provide payments to states to reimburse costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover a portion of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement with cost details to receive a payment equal to 50 percent of the reasonable costs. The Commission will make payments to States for holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies, covering 50% of reasonable costs incurred. States must submit a statement with cost details, and payments will be made within 30 days. States must repay any excess payment over actual costs incurred. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part is provided for fiscal year 2009 and each succeeding fiscal year.
